greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Second member S0(n) of the smallest positive pair (R0(n), S0(n)) for the n-th 1-happy number couple (B(n), C(n)).
comment: In the Zumkeller link "Initial Happy Factorization Data" given in A191860 the a(n) = S0(n) numbers appear for the t = 1 rows in column w.
link: J. H. Conway, On Happy Factorizations, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 1, 1998, #1.
formula: A191855(n)*a(n)^2 - A191854(n)*A263006(n)^2  = +1, and A263006(n) with a(n) is the smallest positive solution for the given 1-happy couple (A191854(n), A191855(n)).
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 28 2015
